Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Selecting setting + suggestions can corrupt value

- Add `files.eol`
- Select the value, with the cursor left to the right of the selection, trigger suggestions, accept the suggestion

- If the cursor goes to the left side of the selection, it replaces the value as expected.

Also reproes in 1.15.2

data.title: [Extension API] vscode.workspace.textDocuments does not return all documents at the beginning
data.body:
I am using `vscode.workspace.textDocuments` to detect all opened and visible text documents.

At the beginning, when I start debugging my extension, I have 3 open text documents, lets say `test_1.php`, `test_2.php`, `test_3.php`.

Now when I access `vscode.workspace.textDocuments`, I only get the active one (in that example `test_1.php`).

When I click on another one (`test_2.php`) and access `vscode.workspace.textDocuments` again, I get the new active document and the previous one (`test_1.php` and `test_2.php`).

When I click on the last, remaining one (`test_3.php`) and access `vscode.workspace.textDocuments` again, I get the list of all documents.

But it seems to depend on the situation, which document has been active at the beginning or has been activated after I have clicked on it.

Is this a bug or a feature?

If a feature: Is there another way to access an up-to-date list of all opened documents?

A while back, I set my "Sort Lines Ascending" keyboard shortcut as "Ctrl + Shift + 1". I noticed now that it's no longer working. I thought maybe my shortcuts got reset, so I went to set it again, but I saw my shortcut exists. I tried resetting by trying to enter the keystrokes again, but it's not recognizing the "1".

data.title: Support multiple (hierarchical) settings files per workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please add support for multiple `settings.json` files per workspace.

Our team has several repositories, and each repository has a committed set of vs code settings to help with formatting files appropriate to that repo.

I would like to have a custom color theme per workspace.

Another coworker would like to disable the autoformatting and run a command line script to do autoformatting before pushing to github.

At the moment, there is not a reasonable way to have personal override settings distinct from team-wide settings on a per repository basis.

Another option would be to provide some way to import a settings override file into `settings.json`.

data.title: Debounce on file read
data.body:
If a file is getting updated every 500ms and we need 1000ms to read that file we end up in a spot where we have too many file reads since they do not get canceled.
Optimally we would cancel an outdated file read if we need to read that file again.

Example program / large file can be found here https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33378

fyi @alexandrudima

data.title: findFiles API should not get default excludes
data.body:
It seems that all API calls inhert the configured exclude settings which isn't what all extensions want.
Start reading here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/31882#issuecomment-326009834

data.title: Cache (and other similar folders) are placed within %APPDATA% rather than %LOCALAPPDATA%
data.body:
On Windows, within %APPDATA%\Code\ are the following folders
- Cache
- CachedData
- GPUCache
- Local Storage

These can be relatively large (by the standards of a Windows roaming profile) - to the extent that on a corporate machine where the size of Roaming Profile is limited by Group Policy, I'm forced to delete them in order to be able to logoff any sync profile.

Their names suggest that they instead belong within %LOCALAPPDATA%




- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Pass max_old_space_size to TSServer
data.body:
Per discussion here: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/18055

Some things I noticed while looking into this:
* I believe either `--max_old_space_size` or `--max-old-space-size` works, v8 args can be dashes or underscores. Underscores work for sure.
* TSServer appears to have special logic if `global.gc` is available, so maybe consider adding `--expose-gc` as well.
* I believe the maximum settings for 64-bit builds of Node is `4096`
* There's this: https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9693. Essentially when running VS Code with the `./script/code.sh` script, setting these flags in `execArgv` options in `typescriptserviceclient.ts` had no effect. I think it'll work if Electron is packaged and ran normally, but I'm not positive.

data.title: TaskProvider: resolveTask() never gets called

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Fedora 26 (x86_64)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new extension
2. Register a `taskProvider` that provides incomplete tasks in `provideTasks()` and completes them in `resolveTask`
3. Launch the extension and list tasks in the command palette

Here is a minimal example:
```typescript
'use strict';

import * as vscode from 'vscode';

export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
    let provider = vscode.workspace.registerTaskProvider('test', {
        provideTasks: () => [new vscode.Task({ type: 'test' }, 'test', 'source')],
        resolveTask: (task: vscode.Task) => {
            task.execution = new vscode.ShellExecution('echo Hello');
            return task;
        }
    });

    context.subscriptions.push(provider);
}

export function deactivate() {
}
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

As I understand, `resolveTask()` should be called to complete incomplete tasks just like with [code lenses](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#CodeLensProvider): `provideCodeLenses()` can return incomplete code lenses that will be later completed upon calling `resolveCodeLens()`.
However, `resolveTask()` never seems to be called at any point, and if `provideTasks()` returns incomplete tasks, these tasks will simply not get listed when trying to list all available tasks.
Am I missing something on how `resolveTask()` is supposed to work, or is there a bug here ? I've tried looking at other task providers, but every single one of them only use `provideTasks()`.

data.title: Automatic semicolon append at end of line in JavaScript/TypeScript
data.body:
A feature request, probably involving the tsserver.

When I enter a new line of code, maybe through IntelliSense, it would be great if a semicolon could automatically be appended to the current line.

Not sure what good preconditions are, maybe when inserting a function call through IntelliSense with return type `void` the tsserver could append a semicolon to the closing parenthesis of the call.

data.title: Git repo sections in git viewlet appear dynamically
data.body:
Testing #33267

Currently the git repo sections appear dynamically as files are opened or after a git init. 
Rather than adding the sections dynamically it would be better when the git extension searches for .gitfolder upfront.
